questions.question: What is the primary role of a Register Transfer Level (RTL) description in the initial stages of digital IC design?
options: To define the physical layout and routing of transistors.
To specify the high-level functional behavior and data flow of the digital circuit.
To perform detailed timing analysis for critical paths.
To generate the final manufacturing masks for fabrication.
To convert analog signals to digital format.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of using instruction pipelining in a Central Processing Unit (CPU)?
options: To reduce the number of transistors required for the CPU.
To allow the CPU to execute instructions in parallel, thereby increasing instruction throughput.
To dynamically adjust the CPU's clock frequency based on workload.
To provide fault tolerance and error correction for critical operations.
To enable direct memory access (DMA) without CPU intervention.

questions.question: In the physical layout of a complex digital integrated circuit, what is the primary function of a robust power delivery network (often implemented as power grids or planes)?
options: To route high-speed clock signals to all sequential elements.
To dissipate heat generated by active components effectively.
To provide stable and low-impedance power (VDD) and ground (GND) connections across the entire chip.
To transmit data between different functional blocks at high bandwidth.
To serve as a substrate for fabricating passive components like resistors and capacitors.

questions.question: In digital logic circuits, what is the primary function of a multiplexer (MUX)?
options: To store a single bit of data.
To perform arithmetic operations like addition or subtraction.
To select one of several input signals and route it to a single output.
To convert a parallel data input into a serial data output.
To invert the logic level of a single input signal.

questions.question: What is the primary function of the Memory Management Unit (MMU) in a modern CPU?
options: To manage the data flow between the CPU and I/O devices.
To translate virtual memory addresses generated by the CPU into physical memory addresses.
To perform arithmetic and logical operations on data.
To store the CPU's instruction set architecture (ISA).
To control the clock frequency and voltage of the CPU.
